definition: gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely

sentences.english: Now he was charged with premeditated murdering, Steenkamp's shooting death valentine's day.
sentences.chinese: 現在皮斯托瑞斯被指控在情人節預謀槍殺斯廷坎普。

sentences.english: There are unconfirmed reports that the two people have been shot in the neighboring town.
sentences.chinese: 未經證實的報道說在附近城鎮有兩個人遭到槍殺。

sentences.english: I don't know. Everybody outside the main building was shot.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道，主樓外面的所有人都被槍殺了。

sentences.english: He raised his spear against three hundred men, whom he killed, and so he became as famous as the Three.
sentences.chinese: 他舉槍殺了三百人，就在三個勇士裏得了名。

sentences.english: Last week, Ingushetia's construction minister was shot to death in his own office.
sentences.chinese: 上週，印古什共和國建設部長在其辦公室被槍殺。

sentences.english: The Taliban claimed responsibility for shooting her.
sentences.chinese: 塔利班聲稱對槍殺這名女警察承擔責任。

sentences.english: Minutes after that, the shootings began in Norris Hall.
sentences.chinese: 在那之後的數分鐘，槍殺在諾里斯大廳開始。

sentences.english: He killed another three people before he was shot dead by police.
sentences.chinese: 在他被警方擊斃以前還槍殺了另外三個人。

sentences.english: His brother was shot while coming home from evening prayer.
sentences.chinese: 來自晚禱回家時，他的哥哥被槍殺。

sentences.english: I asked him if the scouts killed suspected poachers in his area.
sentences.chinese: 我問他巡防隊是否在他的領地內槍殺過嫌疑犯。

sentences.english: Woman killer began in the city killed around businessman.
sentences.chinese: 女殺手開始在城中四處槍殺商人。

sentences.english: The shootings unnerved the most powerful members of Guatemalan society.
sentences.chinese: 槍殺讓危地馬拉社會最有權勢的人物都感到緊張不安。

sentences.english: Lincoln, president of the United States, was murdered in 1864.
sentences.chinese: 林肯，美國總統，在一八六四年被槍殺。

sentences.english: But when hunger is stronger than the fear of being shot, peasant revolts take place.
sentences.chinese: 但當飢餓超過槍殺的恐懼時，農民起義便發生了。

sentences.english: Minutes after that, the shootings began in Norris Hall.
sentences.chinese: 在那之後的數分鐘，槍殺在諾里斯大廳開始。

definition: to shoot with a gun/shooting incident
to open fire/to shoot a gun
terrorist attack (abbr. for 恐怖襲擊|恐怖袭击[kong3 bu4 xi2 ji1])
